dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, B, I was reading this article, and it had a really interesting take on, like, how we think about our careers. It basically says we have *two* jobs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, B, I was reading this article, and it had a really interesting take on, like, how we think about our careers. It basically says we have two jobs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is why it is so critical to understand that you have two jobs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, really? Two? I feel like I'm barely managing one most days! [chuckles] What's the, uh, what's the second one?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, really? Two? I feel like I'm barely managing one most days! What's the, uh, what's the second one?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it frames it as 'Job No. 1' and 'Job No. 2'. Job No. 1 is all about relationships, being, like, other-centered. It's asking, "How can I be most helpful?"
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it frames it as Job No. one and Job No. two. Job No. one is all about relationships, being, like, other-centered. It's asking, How can I be most helpful?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Job no. 1 forces you to value relationships and be other-centered. ... How can I be most helpful? becomes the core of your actions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm, so, not just thinking about my own self-interest, but, like, clients, peers, even your boss? Sounds... altruistic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm, so, not just thinking about my own self-interest, but, like, clients, peers, even your boss? Sounds altruistic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Instead of thinking first about your own self-interest, you think first about the interests of others: clients, peers, and even your boss.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! You're constantly looking for ways to add value, you know? Instead of being that pushy, aggressive type who's always selling something people don't need.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! You're constantly looking for ways to add value, you know? Instead of being that pushy, aggressive type who's always selling something people don't need.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: You constantly look for new ways to add value, and in the process, you become much more useful to the people around you. For example, with clients, you become a person who serves their interests, instead of a pushy, aggressive type who is always selling something they don't need.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, I get Job No. 1. So then, what's Job No. 2? Is that the actual work?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, I get Job No. one. So then, what's Job No. two? Is that the actual work?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's the one that pays the bills, feeds your family. It's the practical stuff, deadlines, pursuing the agenda of the people who hired you.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's the one that pays the bills, feeds your family. It's the practical stuff, deadlines, pursuing the agenda of the people who hired you.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Job no. 2 is how you get paid, feed your family, and pursue the agenda of the people who hired you. ... Your second job has specific, practical goals. It has deadlines.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, the nitty-gritty. And I guess sometimes those two can feel like they're competing, huh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, the nitty-gritty. And I guess sometimes those two can feel like they're competing, huh?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, that's the cool insight! The article says they *don't* compete. Job No. 1 actually makes you much better at Job No. 2. It builds stronger relationships, connects you more deeply.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, that's the cool insight! The article says they don't compete. Job No. one actually makes you much better at Job No. two. It builds stronger relationships, connects you more deeply.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Job no. 1 does not compete with job no. 2. Job no. 1 makes you much better at job no. 2. It builds stronger relationships. It connects you more strongly to others.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That makes sense. Like, if you're genuinely helpful, people are more likely to, uh, reciprocate or just appreciate you. But what about those super altruistic types? You know, they're so busy helping everyone else with Job No. 1, they forget about their own deadlines.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That makes sense. Like, if you're genuinely helpful, people are more likely to, uh, reciprocate or just appreciate you. But what about those super altruistic types? You know, they're so busy helping everyone else with Job No. one, they forget about their own deadlines.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Totally! They give an example of someone spending all morning calling neighbors about a lost cat when they should be organizing a critical meeting. You want to be helpful, but not, like, hopelessly distracted.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally! They give an example of someone spending all morning calling neighbors about a lost cat when they should be organizing a critical meeting. You want to be helpful, but not, like, hopelessly distracted.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Instead of organizing that critical meeting, they end up spending all morning calling neighbors to see if anyone spotted the lost cat that may - or may not - have been wandering on the edge of their neighborhood. You want to be helpful, but not hopeless.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's a fine line. So, it's about doing both, but understanding the purpose of each.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's a fine line. So, it's about doing both, but understanding the purpose of each.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. But here's the catch: you can't be superficial about Job No. 1. Like, only helping people who can help *you* in Job No. 2.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. But here's the catch: you can't be superficial about Job No. one. Like, only helping people who can help you in Job No. two.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If you only help people who can help you in job no. 2, you will soon be revealed as a superficial and somewhat manipulative person.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, I know that type! The ones who are super friendly when you have a big project, but suddenly can't return your calls when you're, uh, between jobs. Manipulative.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, I know that type! The ones who are super friendly when you have a big project, but suddenly can't return your calls when you're, uh, between jobs. Manipulative.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: You know the type... someone who is eager to help you when you have a big job, but who won't return your phone calls when you are looking for a job.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Ugh, yes. Don't be that person. The article says to take both jobs seriously, invest equal energy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ugh, yes. Don't be that person. The article says to take both jobs seriously, invest equal energy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Take both jobs seriously. Invest equal energy in each.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Even though Job No. 1 doesn't pay you, like, cash money?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Even though Job No. one doesn't pay you, like, cash money?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pursue job no. 1 with passion, even though it doesn't pay you in cash money.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Precisely! Not every reward is financial. Some actions feed your soul, enrich your community. It's about, you know, a broader vision of success.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Precisely! Not every reward is financial. Some actions feed your soul, enrich your community. It's about, you know, a broader vision of success.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Not every reward is financial. Some actions feed your soul, enrich your community, and model the sort of behaviors you want your peers, friends, and family members to emulate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I love that. So, if you're a to-do list person, you should have a to-do list for both jobs. That's a great way to, uh, track your progress.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I love that. So, if you're a to-do list person, you should have a to-do list for both jobs. That's a great way to, uh, track your progress.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If you are a to-do list person, make to-do lists for both jobs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And analyze your performance in both. It's not enough to just succeed at the job that pays your bills.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And analyze your performance in both. It's not enough to just succeed at the job that pays your bills.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the end of each week, month, and year analyze your performance and achievements in both positions. It's not enough to succeed at the job that pays your bills.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's a much more holistic approach to, like, your impact in the world, really.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's a much more holistic approach to, like, your impact in the world, really.
